Enter the topic of the page using title casing, matching the H1 if possible, and remaining under 60 characters. Do not include the brand name; it will be added automatically.

Enter a description of the page using sentence casing, remaining between 100 and 150 characters. The format should include the page's topic and value proposition (if relevant), followed by a call-to-action.

seoDescription.en-US:
We build luxury shepherd's huts crafted with charm for both the private
and hospitality markets.
We are a family run business (Andrew and Lucy are brother and sister with Adam and George being good friends), founded in 2024.

We build luxury shepherd's huts crafted with charm for both the private
and hospitality markets.
Welcome to our Gallery - Here are some examples of our beautifully hand-crafted luxury shepherd‚Äôs huts.

content.value: Some text
Hurkle Huts
Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur.
At Hurkle we pride ourselves on creating beautifully designed spaces that can be used for a variety of different applications.
Our huts work perfectly as additional or hospitality accommodation, a home office, a studio, or even a shower block.

Our shepherd‚Äôs huts are handmade by skilled joiners, and our customers
are always at the centre of everything we do.

Whether you are buying one of our ‚Äòoff the shelf designs‚Äô or going for a fully bespoke design, we‚Äôll make sure we walk you through each step of the process, so you know exactly what we are doing and what to expect.
We‚Äôd love to welcome you to view our beautifully crafted huts at our workshop, just outside of Royal Tunbridge Wells.

This will give you the opportunity to see which of our huts might work best for you. 
If you‚Äòd like to visit us, please get in touch through our
contact us
page.

Thanks for contacting us, we'll be in touch.
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ultrices sagittis orci a scelerisque.
We build luxury shepherds huts crafted with charm for both the private and hospitality markets.
Our team of skilled joiners brings decades of expertise, blending craftsmanship from boatbuilding and bespoke joinery to create uniquely beautiful and functional spaces.
While we offer a range of 'off the shelf' designs our bespoke design service allows us to tailor our huts to individual needs.

Our design team help to craft custom-made huts built just for you. What sets us apart is our in-house expertise: our co-founders include a practicing architect and a seasoned boat builder, which ensures our huts have exquisite designs and make the most of relatively modest floorplans.

Our handcrafted huts are built to be enjoyed year-round. Whether you're looking to buy or lease, we‚Äôd love to hear from you so that we can help you explore the possibilities of having a Hurkle hut.

Facilisi cras fermentum odio eu feugiat pretium nibh ipsum consequat. Sagittis purus sit amet volutpat. Morbi leo urna molestie at elementum eu facilisis sed. Pellentesque sit amet porttitor eget dolor morbi non. Augue neque gravida in fermentum. Senectus et netus et malesuada. Et odio pellentesque diam volutpat.
Sem nulla pharetra diam sit amet. In pellentesque massa placerat duis.
Who we are
We are a family run business (Andrew and Lucy are brother and sister with Adam and George being good friends), founded in 2024, in the Kent countryside, just outside Royal Tunbridge Wells.
We build luxury shepherd huts crafted with charm for both the private and hospitality markets.
Our small team is made up of various backgrounds and includes an architect, boat builder, joiners and housing professionals.

We work with clients to bring their vision to life through our bespoke design service, ensuring each of our huts is crafted specifically for our clients‚Äô needs.

You are probably thinking where the name Hurkle came from. Well, it has Scottish origins and to hurkle-durkle is to lounge in bed after it is time to get up. We think that‚Äôs exactly what our huts are for, hence the name Hurkle.
Andrew‚Äôs background is in marketing, and he‚Äôs worked across the UK and in Australia. For the last few years, he has worked in a senior management position for a London based housing group.
Andrew has a passion for travel and the great outdoors. Andrew leads the day to day running of Hurkle.
Here are some examples of our beautifully hand-crafted luxury shepherd‚Äôs huts.
Lucy is a practising architect who has worked on high-end commercial schemes across Europe.
Outside of architecture Lucy has a passion for interior design and she also makes pottery and clothes. Lucy is responsible for all our hut designs and leads our bespoke design service.
George TODO
Adam TODO

seoDescription.en-US: Hurkle Limited customer privacy notice. This privacy notice tells you what to expect us to do with your personal information.

content.value: Hurkle Limited customer privacy notice
This privacy notice tells you what to expect us to do with your personal information.
Our contact details
Email: info@hurkle.co.uk

title.en-US: What information we collect, use, and why

content.value: What information we collect, use, and why
We collect or use the following information to
provide services and goods, including delivery:

- Names and contact details
- Addresses
- Website user information (including user journeys and cookie tracking)

We collect or use the following information for
service updates or marketing purposes:

- Names and contact details
- Addresses
- Marketing preferences
- Location data
- IP addresses
- Website and app user journey information
How long we keep information
We keep your information for up to five years.
Your data protection rights
Under data protection law, you have rights including:
Your right of access
- You have the right to ask us for copies of your personal data.
Your right to rectification
- You have the right to ask us to rectify personal data you think is inaccurate. You also have the right to ask us to complete information you think is incomplete.
Your right to erasure
- You have the right to ask us to erase your personal data in certain circumstances.
Your right to restriction of processing
- You have the right to ask us to restrict the processing of your personal data in certain circumstances.
Your right to object to processing
- You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data in certain circumstances.
Your right to data portability
- You have the right to ask that we transfer the personal data you gave us to another organisation, or to you, in certain circumstances.
Your right to withdraw consent

‚Äì When we use consent as our lawful basis you have the right to withdraw your consent.

You don‚Äôt usually need to pay a fee to exercise your rights. If you make a request, we have one calendar month to respond to you.
To make a data protection rights request, please contact us using the contact details at the top of this privacy notice.
How to complain

If you have any concerns about our use of your personal data, you can make a complaint to us using the contact details at the top of this privacy notice.

If you remain unhappy with how we‚Äôve used your data after raising a complaint with us, you can also complain to the ICO.

The ICO‚Äôs address:
Information Commissioner‚Äôs Office
Wycliffe House
Water Lane
Wilmslow
Cheshire
SK9 5AF
Helpline number: 0303 123 1113

Website:
https://www.ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint
Lawful bases
Our lawful bases for collecting or using personal information to
provide services and goods are

:

- Consent

Our lawful bases for collecting or using personal information for service updates or marketing purposes are:

- Consent
